value.title: AI business school for healthcare
value.excerpt: Learn to develop an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare, including machine learning technologies, culture, and responsible AI.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise finance organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

value.title: AZ-104: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure key Azure network capabilities and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect your local on-premises networks into Azure using virtual networks, VPN gateways, and Azure ExpressRoute.

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to plan and implement an IP addressing scheme for virtual networks and virtual machines in Azure.

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

topItems.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
topItems.excerpt: Find out how Azure network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

value.title: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure and manage key Azure network capabilities.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect your local on-premises networks into Azure using virtual networks, VPN gateways, and Azure ExpressRoute.

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to plan and implement an IP addressing scheme for virtual networks and virtual machines in Azure.

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

topItems.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
topItems.excerpt: Find out how Azure network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to write code in .NET applications using Azure Service Bus for communications that can handle high demand, low bandwidth, and hardware failures.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Event Hubs to reliably process high-volume data streams to enable you to code applications to send and receive messages through the hub.

value.title: Process natural language with Azure Cognitive Language Services
value.excerpt: Process natural language with Azure Cognitive Language Services

topItems.title: Add basic conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
topItems.excerpt: Learn to identify valuable information in conversations with LUIS for interpreting user goals (intents) and distill valuable information from sentences (entities).

topItems.title: Manage your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn to manage LUIS apps through versioning, key management, handling data, and improving predictions.

topItems.title: Use containers for your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
topItems.excerpt: The Language Understanding (LUIS) container loads your trained or published Language Understanding model. As a LUIS app, the docker container provides access to the query predictions from the container's API endpoints

topItems.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the Text Analytics API and Azure Functions to discover what your customers are really saying in their feedback about your products or brands.

value.title: Is Azure Free Account really free? | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to use Microsoft Azure for free, for 12 months.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips  Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: http://azure.com/free

value.title: Architect a data platform in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect a data platform in Azure and build solutions to store relational and NoSQL data.

topItems.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Automate your workflow with GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn how GitHub Actions enables you to automate your software development cycle and deploy applications to Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

topItems.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create workflows that enable you to use Continuous Integration (CI) for your projects.

topItems.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create two deployment workflows using GitHub Actions and Microsoft Azure.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a security and compliance plan
value.excerpt: Build strategies around security and compliance and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Active Directory to you secure your internal, external, and customer identities.

topItems.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory.

topItems.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
topItems.excerpt: Securely authenticate apps to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities give your app an Azure AD identity.

topItems.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault

value.title: AZ-400: Manage source control
value.excerpt: Use GitHub to build a modern source control strategy and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

topItems.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

topItems.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Azure Static Web Apps is a modern web app service that offers streamlined full-stack development from source code to global high availability.

topItems.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps. Use Visual Studio Code to create and run the web app locally.

topItems.title: Publish an API to Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

topItems.title: Authenticate users with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with API and authentication using Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

topItems.title: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps

value.title: Build applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to collaborate with others to continuously build, test, and verify your applications using Azure Pipelines and GitHub.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Implement a code workflow in your build pipeline by using Git and GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn along with the Space Game web team the benefits of collaboration through Visual Studio Code and GitHub.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

value.title: Cloud computing basics for developers
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on cloud computing for developers from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types. This learning path prepares developers for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for developers
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover what the cloud is, the history of cloud computing, what types of clouds are available, and how you might use the cloud.

topItems.title: Economics of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how developers pay to use the cloud and how cloud providers are able to charge for their services. Get an overview of how the cloud is kept secure.

topItems.title: Datacenter trends in cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Datacenters are what power the cloud. Learn what they are, how they work, and challenges in managing them.

topItems.title: Datacenter components
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into datacenters to discover how they are laid out and how computing resources are provisioned and metered.

value.title: Deploy and manage resources in Azure by using Bicep
value.excerpt: Learn how Bicep enables you to manage both basic and complex infrastructure deployments on Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to infrastructure as code using Bicep
topItems.excerpt: Describe the benefits of using infrastructure as code, Azure Resource Manager, and Bicep to quickly and confidently scale your cloud deployments.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure resources by using Bicep templates
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Bicep templates and create reusable infrastructure as code.

topItems.title: Build reusable Bicep templates by using parameters
topItems.excerpt: Control and apply parameters to a Bicep template while protecting sensitive inputs.

topItems.title: Build flexible Bicep templates by using conditions and loops
topItems.excerpt: Build advanced Bicep templates by using conditions to conditionally deploy resources and using loops to deploy multiple instances of resources.

value.title: Deploy applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous delivery (CD) pipeline that automates the process of deploying your application.

topItems.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Design and create a realistic release pipeline that promotes changes to various testing and staging environments.

topItems.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

topItems.title: Run nonfunctional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run automated load tests by using Apache JMeter, a form of nonfunctional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Develop and deploy applications on Kubernetes
value.excerpt: Create, deploy, and maintain Kubernetes-native applications using AKS.

topItems.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application by using Azure Kubernetes Service declarative manifest files.

topItems.title: Application and package management using Helm
topItems.excerpt: Helm is an application package manager for Kubernetes that you use to standardize and simplify the deployment of cloud-native applications on Kubernetes. Here you'll see how to install third-party packages called Helm charts and how to create and install Helm charts for the workloads your teams develop.

topItems.title: Configure an Azure Kubernetes Service deployment pipeline using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create an automated deployment pipeline by using GitHub Actions along with Azure Kubernetes Service.

topItems.title: Deploy and manage a stateful application using CosmosDB and Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Create and manage a stateful application with an external storage using CosmosDB and Azure Kubernetes Service

value.title: Discover ways to foster an AI-ready culture in your business
value.excerpt: Learn AI solutions to implement based upon organization maturity and a framework to drive the key changes that are necessary to become an AI-ready organization.

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: Understand the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and a framework to drive the change needed in your organization for a successful AI strategy.

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise finance organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in marketing
topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise marketing organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in sales
topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise sales organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

value.title: Get started with blockchain development
value.excerpt: Learn about blockchain and development on the Ethereum platform. Discover what skills you need to begin building your own blockchain networks at scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to blockchain on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to blockchain on Azure. See how blockchain allows business partners to trust each other's data without a central authority. You'll also learn a bit about how blockchain works. The goal is to help you decide if blockchain is a good choice for your scenario.

topItems.title: Learn how to use Solidity
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Solidity can help you program smart contracts for the Ethereum blockchain platform.

topItems.title: Write Ethereum smart contracts by using Solidity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to install tools that you can use to develop smart contracts.

topItems.title: Create tokens using OpenZeppelin
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the significance of tokens and how they are used in blockchain.

value.title: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Migrate and Azure Database Migration Service.

topItems.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Migrate ASP.NET Apps to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate ASP.NET web applications and their data to Azure App Service and Azure SQL Database to take advantage of the cloud.

topItems.title: Introduction to migrating ASP.NET apps to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Migrating an ASP.NET application from on-premises to Azure, along with a supporting Azure SQL database, can provide many advantages, but also challenges. Learn how to evaluate the migration process to determine if it’s right for your application.

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Create a website in the programming language of your choice through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Migrate an on-premises web application to Azure App Service
topItems.excerpt: Use the Azure App Service Migration Assistant to assess the readiness of a web app to be deployed on App Service, and perform the migration.

value.title: Protect identity and access with Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: The **Identity and Access learning path** covers the latest identity and access technologies, tools for strengthening authentication, and guidance on identity protection within your organization. Microsoft access and identity technologies enable you to secure your organization’s identity, whether it is on-premises or in the cloud, and empower your users to work securely from any location.

topItems.title: Define identity and access management in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about identity and access management in Azure Active Directory and why identity is a core component of your organization’s security posture.

topItems.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about identity governance and how you can safeguard access to your organization’s data.

topItems.title: Strengthen authentication (conditional access) with Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about modern authentication and the security benefits it provides to your organization, such as enabling multi-factor authentication and a passwordless environment.

topItems.title: Secure administrator accounts in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about securing administrator accounts through secure devices, dedicated administrator accounts, and just-in-time privileges.
